content.description: Starts with easy low angle climbing that gets a little harder near the top as one must pas over a few bulges. The crus is definitely making it over the last bulge, but it is protected well by the last bolt.
content.protection: Two bolts, both near the top of the route where the climbing difficulty increases.
content.location: Near the center of the South/West facing rock near the top of the ridge.

content.description: Getting up above the first bolt and on one's way to the second can be a little changing, but the true crux is working one's way over the bulge and above the final bolt to the anchor.
content.location: This route is located on the left side (near the tree and bushes) of the South/West facing rock near the top of the ridge.

content.description: An easy scramble up to the crux on an overhung feature, with huecos and crimps.
content.protection: 3 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor. One of the anchor bolts spins, but you can sling a knob at the top for extra protection.
content.location: Furthest route to the right on the Claw & Beak formation. TR can be accessed from the same place as other routes on The Claw, but on the other side of the boulder at the top.
